documents.title: weather : thundery overnight showers possible
text: further showers during the first part of the night could be heavy and thundery in places across the bbc east region , but everywhere should become dry with clear spells and isolated fog patches .
temperatures in rural areas are likely to drop .
minimum temperature : 12c ( 54f )
saturday should get off to a dry start with some sunshine , but eventually cloud will thicken and there 'll be the risk of showers - some again turning heavy and thundery .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f )
more details from bbc weather :
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: jeremy corbyn in northampton : 'children are let down by housing system '
text: the money has to be found to help homeless people - according to labour leader jeremy corbyn .
i spoke to mr corbyn during a visit to northampton 's hope centre earlier today .
he told me housing is a `` national crisis '' and a `` waste of resources '' .
he said : `` children growing up in expensive , badly-run private rented accommodation , being made homeless every six months or a year , changing schools , moving around , do n't achieve in school .
`` they do n't achieve so much as they could in life . ''
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Northampton Politics Reporter

documents.title: second soldier from northampton arrested by anti-terror police
text: a second man from northampton has been arrested as part of a terrorism investigation centred on the royal anglian regiment of the british army .

he was originally detained by the royal military police in cyprus and is now being questioned by the west midlands police counter terrorism unit on sus of links to the banned neo-nazi national action group .
another 24-year-old man from northampton and three other serving members of the army were arrested on tuesday .
three of them are believed to be from the royal anglian regiment ; the fourth with the royal electrical and mechanical engineers .
police say the arrests were pre-planned and intelligence-led and that there was no threat to the public 's safety .

the men are being held on sus of being concerned in the commission , preparation and instigation of acts of terrorism under the terrorism act 2000 ; namely on sus of being members of a proscribed organisation .

national action , described by the home office as `` virulently racist , anti-semitic and homophobic '' , became the first extreme right-wing group to be banned under terrorism laws in december 2016 .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: northamptonshire beat sussex by six wickets
text: northamptonshire have beaten sussex on day four of their county championship match against sussex at wantage road .
the final scoreboard : northamptonshire 426 & 140-4 v sussex 172 & 393 ( f/o ) .

documents.title: jeremy corbyn in northampton : labour leader pledges to build more council housing
text: jeremy corbyn has been visiting the county today as part of his summer campaign tour .
the labour leader has been to the northampton 's hope centre , which works to tackle the causes of homelessness , and the pen sure start centre in corby .
while there he spoke to homeless people and volunteers at the centre .
mr corbyn told me homelessness was increasing due to `` expensive private rented accommodation , a lack of new-build council accommodation and individual cases of family break-up '' .
he said he is determined to regulate the private rented sector and build more council housing .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Northampton Politics Reporter

documents.title: daventry council urged to remove under 14 ban from school building
text: the mayor of daventry has urged district council officials to remove a restriction on pupils using a new school building in the town .

the parker e-act academy has taken over the former university technical college building and had hoped to house its new year 7 students there - but there 's a covenant which states it ca n't be used by pupils under the age of 14 .
year 7s are aged 11 and 12 .

mayor lynne taylor said : `` i know that parents are concerned [ as to why their children ca n't go to that building ] because they were supposed to come here from september and now they 're not and when i see the facilities i think it 's disappointing that they ca n't .
`` i think those who have the power to do something about it should listen very carefully to the parents of 210 children . ''

daventry district council said that the lease included a requirement that the site is used primarily for students age 14-19 and following discussion about options , the council received assurances from e-act and the education & skills funding agency ( esfa ) that these terms would be complied with .
business manager simon bowers said : `` e-act was well aware of the requirement for 14-19 use back in april 2017 .
`` the council was content with this arrangement .
`` however it would appear that the message received by parents may have been somewhat different to the position reached by the council , e-act and the esfa .
`` the council remains happy to discuss a way forward with e-act . ''
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: date set for eleanor cross emergency maintenance
text: we 've told you before about the concern over the dilapidated state of northampton 's eleanor cross .
the scheduled and grade i listed monument has been a feature of the town since the 13th century and it is now in urgent need of repair .
the good news is that comprehensive survey work and emergency maintenance will start on 16 october .
the cross , situated at the southern end of london road close to delapre wood , is one of just three surviving monuments of 12 commissioned by edward i between 1291 and 1294 .
each cross marks one of 12 nightly resting places of his wife , queen eleanor of castile , during her funeral procession from harby , near lincoln , to london .
the cross itself is missing from the top of the one in northampton .
northampton borough council claims it does not own the cross .
the county council says the same , but with the cross deteriorating , the borough has taken responsibility for its maintenance .

it said it is continuing to investigate ownership , but in the meantime has taken the decision to carry out emergency maintenance work and commission a full condition survey to inform any necessary future work .
councillor tim hadland said : `` we continue to work with cliveden conservation and historic england to ensure this project is carried out in the right way and to the monument 's benefit .
`` we all want to see the cross protected and that is precisely why the borough council has pushed ahead . ''

a historic england spokesperson said : `` we welcome the commissioning of a condition survey by northampton borough council to assess what works are required to safeguard the town 's nationally important eleanor cross for our own and future generations . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rev richard coles : same-sex dance couples 'might be appropriate '
text: strictly come dancing contestant , reverend richard coles , has said same-sex couples on this year 's show might be appropriate .

the anglican vicar of finedon near wellingborough , said : `` it 's an interesting one particularly this year when we mark the 50th anniversary of the change in law and the partial decriminalisation of homosexuality .
`` i 've heard nothing yet , but it might be perhaps this year some sort of gesture in that direction would be appropriate . ''
the former keyboard player in the communards is one of 15 contestants on this year 's programme - and the launch show can be seen this saturday on bbc one at 19:00 .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man in hospital after 'targeted attack ' with 'noxious substance '
text: a man has been arrested after a 25-year-old man was taken to hospital suffering from skin irritation following a `` targeted attack '' involving what 's been described as a noxious substance in northampton .
emergency services were called to thenford street at 04:45 on thursday and a 24-year-old man was detained for possession of an offensive weapon .
northamptonshire police said the incident is being linked to another which took place nearby .
det sgt johnny campbell said : `` the noxious substance used was not believed to be an acid .
`` we have made one arrest and believe this was a targeted attack . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

BBC News

documents.title: police investigation 'requires time ' after van damaged 30 cars
text: northamptonshire police has tried to reassure people whose cars were damaged by a van last thursday afternoon that `` a lot of work is being done '' in the investigation .
about 30 vehicles were hit by the van , which witnesses described as being driven `` erratically on three wheels '' on oliver street in the kingsley area of northampton .
several residents have told me they do n't feel like the case is being taken seriously enough and want more to be done .
insp dave rayfield said : `` this remains very much a live investigation and a lot of work is being done to obtain statements from potential witnesses .
`` we have conducted calls to the list of witnesses and victims that have so far come forward and they have identified further witnesses .
`` all avenues of inquiry remain open and investigations such as this , with multiple victims , often require time to complete . ''
one man arrested was cautioned and a second was released under investigation .
author: Elinor Cross
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: four arrests after shotgun reports
text: four people have been questioned by police after reports of people carrying shotguns in corby .
armed officers were called to the gretton brook road area on tuesday and they arrested two men and two teenage boys .
a spokesman for northamptonshire police said : `` an extensive search of the local area has taken place and a shotgun has been recovered .
`` officers from cid investigating the incident would like to hear from anyone who may have any information about it . ''
the four people arrested have been released under investigation .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

sussex are 240-7 following on , still trailing by 14 .
tea is due at 15:30

two wickets in an over from rory kleinveldt and northants are firmly back on course for victory # bbccricket

documents.title: adam simmonds : where are all the evangelical police commissioners ?
text: adam simmonds was a controversial figure during his time as northamptonshire 's first police and crime commissioner ( pcc ) .

plans to sell part of the force headquarters to house a new free school , merge the police and fire service and the introduction of an office of faith-based and community initiatives divided opinion .
many of his ideas have since been scrapped by his successor and fellow conservative , stephen mold .
mr simmonds was also considered something of an evangelist for the role , held up by government as an example of how it should work .
his view on how the pcc position is developing is therefore of interest .
he said crime commissioners should stand out `` against the status quo '' rather than `` taking on huge bureaucracy '' and `` simply agreeing with how the police operate '' .
`` i find it very hard looking round the country now to see any people who believe that , '' he added .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Northampton Politics Reporter

documents.title: adam simmonds : former pcc says northants should have an elected mayor
text: northamptonshire should have an elected mayor similar to those in london , manchester and the west midlands , says the county 's former police and crime commissioner ( pcc ) .
adam simmonds , who was pcc 2012-16 , said the notion someone should just run the police service is out of date .
`` we should be looking broader to public services , '' he said .
mr simmonds called for `` less county councils , less local councils , more directly elected individuals '' .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Northampton Politics Reporter

documents.title: railway 'scrap metal ' in northampton university bomb scare
text: a `` suspected explosive device '' that brought work on a £ 330m university construction site in northampton to a halt on wednesday was , in fact scrap metal , and it probably came from an old railway track , bomb disposal experts believe .
two suspected world war two mortars were discovered at 09:45 at the university of northampton 's new waterside campus development , close to an old railway line at malthouse close .
the site was evacuated and cordoned off while bomb disposal experts from raf wittering in cambridgeshire examined the items .
they quickly established they were `` not mortars '' and not explosives .
the site was reopened on wednesday afternoon , but what were the items that caused this alert ?
to the untrained eye they certainly do resemble mortars , but here 's what a real one looks like :
there are two differences between the items on the building site and the real deal above , that can easily be seen if you know what to look for .
the ends of the northampton `` devices '' are `` crimped '' , unlike genuine mortars , ed palmer , spokesman for the raf 's bomb squad at wittering says .
also , from the `` tail '' end of the building site items , `` you can tell these things were never intended to fly '' .
although they do look a bit like mortars , mr palmer said they are either `` track or point pins - something used to either secure or identify tracks on railway points '' .
however , he added : `` do n't take the chance .
if you find something sus do not attempt to touch it or move it .
call the police and we will come out and deal with it . ''
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: mp questions delay in finding new sponsors for failing academy schools
text: teaching unions and politicians are saying it 's taking too long for nine schools in northamptonshire to have new sponsors appointed to run them .

it 's been six months since the education fellowship trust announced it 'd be giving up all the nine schools it manages due to poor performance in five of them , but still no new trust has been appointed .
the government - via its regional schools commissioner - is looking for another academy trust to take them on but all those negotiations go on behind closed doors , due to confidentiality .
the conservative mp for wellingborough , peter bone , has seven of the affected schools in his constituency and says he has asked the schools minister what is happening .
`` everyone from the schools minister down expected this to be done prior to september and i do n't know why there is a delay , '' he said .
`` there are a lot of confidentiality agreements floating around so it 's rather difficult to get information .
`` i 've written to the schools minister asking for clarity on what is happening and more importantly when a final decision is to be made . ''
the department for education says there will be `` an announcement in due course '' .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: hospital improving but still 'inadequate '
text: hospital improving but still 'inadequate '

documents.title: detectives have more time to question royal anglians arrested on sus of terror offences
text: detectives have been given more time to question four men , who serve with the army 's royal anglian regiment , who were arrested on sus of terrorism offences .

the men , including a 24-year-old arrested in ipswich and a 24-year-old arrested in northampton , were detained on tuesday on sus of being concerned in the commission , preparation and instigation of acts of terrorism .
they were also arrested on sus of being members of national action - a proscribed neo-nazi organisation .
the other two suspects were a 22-year-old arrested in birmingham and a 32-year-old arrested in powys .
all four men are being held at a police station in the west midlands .
detectives have been given a further five days to question them .
the arrests were pre-planned and intelligence-led , and police say there was no threat to the public 's safety .

documents.title: northampton 'must use defeat as spur '
text: northampton 'must use defeat as spur '

documents.title: horton hospital cuts : authorities can seek judicial review
text: politicians in the south of the county have welcomed a step forward in the challenge to cuts in services at an nhs hospital .

a judge has ruled that four local authorities , including south northamptonshire council , can seek a judicial review into plans to reduce things like maternity services and critical care at the horton hospital in banbury - which serves patients from northamptonshire .
the councils have argued that the two-part consultation exercise carried out by health managers was `` fundamentally flawed '' .

south northamptonshire council leader ian mccord said : `` we 've always argued that you can not split this consultation into two halves because decisions taken in the first part could have a direct effect on something in the second .
`` that 's the point we 've been trying to make to them and it has been ignored hitherto .

`` we had a bit of a setback when the initial request was turned down , but we did push on for a hearing at court and we were very lucky to get someone who said 'yes , let 's proceed to a full hearing ' . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingmore time to question neo-nazi suspects
text: police have been given more time to question four serving members of the army who were arrested on sus of terrorism offences and membership of banned neo-nazi group national action .
the west midlands force is talking to a 22-year-old from birmingham , a 32-year-old from powys , a 24-year-old from ipswich and a 24-year-old from northampton .
police say the arrests were planned and intelligence-led and there had been no threat to public safety .

documents.title: suspect 'bomb ' removed from university campus development
text: this is the scene at the university of northampton 's waterside campus - where a suspected explosive device was discovered earlier today .
the area around malthouse close was cordoned off after reports of the device close to the old railway line .
construction work on the £ 330m development was halted to allow members of the cambridgeshire-based raf explosive ordnance disposal team to investigate .
although judging by this snap - it does n't look that dangerous
this afternoon , work has resumed on the site .
a spokesman for the university said the sus objects `` are not explosive '' - but police still do n't know what they are .

documents.title: 'suspected explosives device ' found near new university campus
text: police have placed a cordon around a northampton construction site after a suspected explosives device was found .
officers were called at 09:45 following the discovery near the new waterside development , close to an old railway line at malthouse close .
the £ 330m development houses the university of northampton 's new waterside campus which is due to open in about a year .
the force said it was currently waiting for an raf explosive ordnance disposal team from cambridgeshire to arrive .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

the penalty for not wearing a seat-belt is a fixed penalty charge of £ 100 or , if prosecuted , up to £ 500 .

documents.title: on this day : diana , princess of wales , buried in northamptonshire
text: it 's exactly 20 years since diana , princess of wales , was buried at the spencer family home - althorp house near northampton .
thousands lined the streets on 6 september 1997 to see her cortege make its way from the m1 to the spencer family home .
the very public day of mourning ended with a private ceremony when diana was finally buried on an island in the middle of the oval lake in the heart of her family estate .
a temple dedicated to her stands on the edge of the lake .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northants backing up good startnorthamptonshire 383-5 ( 89 overs ) v sussex
text: northamptonshire have a few bad habits with the bat in the county championship , one of which is failing to back up a good day the following morning .
but here , they 've enjoyed an excellent start to day two and are set for a big total - it 's just the second time they 've gone past 350 this season .
key to their progress has been a debut fifty for on-loan lancastrian luke procter .
he 's looked calm , organised and with a clear game plan - the perfect foil to the stroke-makers elsewhere in the order .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport at Wantage Road

documents.title: homeless charity close to temporary shelter deal
text: a charity in corby is close to agreeing a deal for a temporary homeless shelter after plans for a permanent base fell through .
corby nightlight raised about £ 25,000 for a drop-in centre and shelter on wood street but , within weeks of planning permission being granted , the deal collapsed .
since then , the situation has turned nasty .

some people on social media blamed the collapse of the deal on local businesses which had objected to the shelter , and those businesses claim they 've received online abuse for trying to protect their interests .
the manager of cafe mozart , which is next door to the proposed shelter , claims one post even suggested burning down his cafe because of his stand against the shelter .
corby nightlight is now hopeful of reaching agreement on a temporary shelter in a church hall elsewhere in corby , to operate between november and march .
it 's still looking for a permanent base .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: county cricket : match against sussex to resume
text: it 's the second day of northants ' county championship match against sussex at wantage road .
the county are 329-5 in their first innings after ben duckett scored 193 yesterday .
play resumes at 10:30 , with full online commentary through the bbc sport website .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: today 's weather : mostly dry
text: a north-westerly wind today will bring a cooler , fresher feel to things .
after a bright start there are due to be some good spells of sunshine during the morning .
in the afternoon , a little bit more cloud will come in bringing the possibility of an isolated shower , but it will be mostly dry .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: wellingborough mp says leaked immigration plans reflect referendum result
text: the conservative mp for wellingborough said he was pleased with what was being suggested after a leaked home office document revealed some of the government 's draft proposals for a new immigration system after brexit .
it suggested the plans would dramatically reduce the number of low-skilled eu migrants who could come to the uk after it left the european union .
the draft document - published by the guardian newspaper - suggests the end of freedom of movement would be followed by time limits on how long eu nationals travelling here could stay .
peter bone , who campaigned for brexit , said : `` i knocked on thousands of doors all over the country and that was really the number one issue .

`` we needed to end free of movement and reduce the number of people coming from the european union to this country , so i think actually the government is implementing what the referendum result decided . ''

documents.title: duckett enjoying his day in the ( evening ) sunnorthamptonshire 232-3 v sussex
text: ben duckett has made his third county championship century in four matches at wantage road and is beginning to revive a campaign that began poorly .
how northants need his runs at this vital time of the season , as you would say they probably need to win this game to revive their promotion hopes .
duckett has looked back to somewhere near his best - initially benefitting from some loose bowling to get a solid start and then finding his fluency with strokes around the wicket .
there 's been little in the wicket and sussex are fortunate to have up a bowling point - two dismissals coming through careless hooks that were caught in the deep .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: drive to recruit more foster carers in northamptonshire
text: a fresh campaign is beginning to find more people prepared to act as foster carers in northamptonshire .
the county council says it has 1,000 children in its care , many of whom could benefit from being fostered .
paul martin , from denton , and his wife have been foster carers for nearly 10 years .
they care mainly for babies and say it 's a challenging but rewarding job .
`` you always know when a child comes into care with you that at some point they 're going to go , '' he said .
`` it 's probably one of the hardest things you have to deal with .
`` it is a double-edged sword though , because you 're personally sad they 're going to be leaving , but you 're happy because they 're going to be settled . ''
mr martin added that being foster carers has changed he and his wife for the better .
`` we 're probably more resilient than we thought we were , and a lot more open too , '' he said .
`` before you 're a foster carer you 're not aware of the needs of some children who are in society and the difficulties that some families have . ''
zisko brown is a social worker in northamptonshire , she says foster carers need several key qualities .
`` we need people who have the ability to provide warmth , empathy and encouragement , and of course people who are able to keep children safe from harm and abuse , '' she said .
`` we also need individual who have the ability to produce structure and boundaries , with fairness and empathy . ''
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hasselbank 'honoured ' to be appointed northampton town manager
text: jimmy floyd hasselbaink has said he is `` honoured '' to be appointed as the new manager of northampton town .
the 45-year-old former chelsea and netherlands striker has signed a three-year deal with the club .
hasselbaink has previously been in charge at burton albion and qpr .

documents.title: police 'need further witnesses ' after van damaged 30 cars
text: two men questioned by police , after a van hit about 30 cars in northampton , have been released .
witnesses described the van being driven `` erratically on three wheels '' in the kingsley area on thursday afternoon , with the worst damage on oliver street .
one man arrested was cautioned and the other was released under investigation .
pc richard earl said they need to speak to more witnesses and are still assessing the damage to the vehicles :
he said : `` we 're still looking into that and i know of two which are likely to be written off .
`` what we really need is to speak to anybody who can identify the driver . ''
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: heavy defeat will not dent saints ' season , captain pledges
text: northampton 's 55-24 premiership defeat by saracens was `` humbling '' , but will not `` derail '' their campaign , captain dylan hartley claims .
saints trailed 41-3 at the break at twickenham and went on to concede nine tries in their season-opener at the weekend .
`` there were a lot of people writing us off before this tournament and a lot of people 's prophecies were confirmed today , '' hartley told bbc radio northampton .
`` we will stay together , keep our heads down and keep working , but this defeat is humbling .
`` half-time was a reality check .
by then a rant was n't going to save the day .
we 'd been way too slow , way too passive in defence and in 50/50 turnover balls and transitions .
`` we went out in the second half and said 'let 's take the shackles off , let 's try and take something from the game ' .
`` we got three tries , but we were chasing the four-try bonus point so it 's frustrating not to salvage that .
we were n't clinical enough . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: driver 'lucky ' to escape serious injury in crash
text: a van driver was `` extremely lucky '' not to have suffered far more serious injuries after his vehicle struck a tree near warmington in warwickshire , say the ambulance service .
the crash happened on banbury road , on the road to gaydon at around 09:44 today .
the driver , who was initially unconscious , was taken to university hospital in coventry suffering chest and back injuries .

documents.title: bill for a6 road repairs still not settled
text: the bill for repairs to the a6 has still not been settled , despite the section between rothwell and desborough reopening today after it was closed for repair works in january .
large holes were found underneath the carriageway close to a bridge over the river ise during a routine inspection .
rebecca miller from northamptonshire county council 's highways department said the issue of who will bear the cost of the work is still being sorted out .
rothwell county councillor jim hakewill has said central government should make a contribution to the cost as there remains doubt over who will pay the final bill .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: 'why i gave back my beauty queen crown '
text: 'why i gave back my beauty queen crown '

documents.title: a6 road section reopens after eight-month closure for repairs
text: a five-mile stretch of the a6 , which has been closed between rothwell and desborough since january , has reopened .
the section of the road over the river ise was closed when large holes were discovered underneath its surface during routine inspections .
soon afterwards similar problems were found nearby meaning repair works would take even longer .
drivers have had to use a long diversion route , along the a14 , a43 , a6003 and back round on the a427 .
but today the road 's reopened to traffic - just in time for the new school term .
northamptonshire highways have thanked local people and businesses for their patience .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton
